question:
How the Constitution of India has enabled the independent and unbiased nature of audit by the CAG?
  1. Appointment of CAG is done by President while taking views of not only prime minister but also Leader of opposition
  2. Removal of CAG is very difficult and needs concurrence of President, Chief Justice of Supreme Court as well as Prime Minister
  3. Salary and expenses of CAG are charged expenditures
Which of the above is / are correct statements?
explanation:
Appointment of CAG is done by President while taking views of not only prime minister but also Leader of opposition
This is incorrect statement. The president appoints on recommendation by Prime Minister.
Removal of CAG is very difficult and needs concurrence of President, Chief Justice of Supreme Court as well as Prime Minister
This is incorrect statement. Removal of CAG is difficult because follows same procedure as that of removal of a judge of Supreme Court.
Salary and expenses of CAG are charged expenditures
 This is correct statement. Charged expenditures are not voted by legislature.
